snippet: If government economic statistics prove to be wrong, it may have more to do with how they are compiled than with deliberate manipulation.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column examines skepticism concerning economic recovery, noting that those on the left have questioned distribution of gains while those on the right accuse Obama administration of manipulating economic data; expresses doubt that figures could be result of conspiracy, noting that if government figures prove to be wrong, it will likely be due to how they were compiled rather than deliberate manipulation.
lead_paragraph: If government economic statistics prove to be wrong, it may have more to do with how they are compiled than with deliberate manipulation.

headline.print_headline: Don’t Believe the Number? Consider the Source
headline.main: Doubting the Economic Data? Consider the Source
